Reviews.Content: Cancel our reservation as soon as we saw the room! We checked in at Kitcho after taking quite abit to time to find it. The lady behind the counter spoke no english though we had our translator with us so that helped. However after we checked in, got our bags in the room, we pretty much checked straight out. I couldn't believe it after such great reviews on tripadvisor, I was sure it will be a great stay but the carpet was extremely dirty, the room very small and the opening windows were very low, it was from our knee high up and very close to the bed, my partner is quite tall and I was worried he would fall out the window at night if he had a couple of drinks! After a few minutes in the room and feeling rather disappointed with it we decided to tell the lady that we'd like to cancel our reservation and I think she took offence to that which was not intended but we couldn't stay there. The room was on the 6th floor western style double. We walked around the corner and for about $16AUD more we found a proper hotel with reception staff etc... Maybe some of the other rooms are nicer but certainly not the one we had and we were not willing to pay $130AUD per night for it.
Reviews.Author: BlaineAmy

Reviews.Content: Great little place! My friend and I came and stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in Feb 2008. It was our first time in Asia and not sure what to expect. We walked the wrong way at first (walk down the street in between the 100 yen store and the McDonalds, about 4 blocks and the hotel is on the right in front of a little park). We loved the hotel, very nice staff (only one english speaker though), comfortable beds, free bottled water every day. The bathroom was very tiny but we didn't mind. We felt safe and taken care of there. The neighborhood was quiet and had many great places to eat nearby!
Reviews.Author: Travelgal81

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel The Hotel Kitcho was a pleasant surprise from our previous hotel.The twin room we booked had 2 double beds and the room was very spacious. Just like a normal hotel room you would get in Australia. The bathroom was the usual tiny capsule type you get in Japan but it had liquid soap,shampoo,razors,toothbrushes and hairbrushes.There were 2 free bottles of water per day and a stocked mini bar.We enjoyed the 2 filter coffee sachets we got each day and there was green tea and english tea.Our window looked out to the street and a small concrete park in the middle of the road. The first morning at 6.30am i was woken to some faint japanese music. I looked out the window and there were about 20 japanese senior citizens doing exercise down in the park.I loved the neighbourhood so quaint and quiet.
Reviews.Author: tropic3

Reviews.Content: Kitcho Hotel, Tokyo I have been staying in this hotel for close to 25 years and cannot even think of staying elsewhere in Tokyo! The neighborhood is one of the oldest in the city, and one is transported to earlier ways of life in Japan - totally unhurried, gentle and quiet. The hotel is unmatched for location, service and price.
Reviews.Author: sash88

Reviews.Content: I miss the Kitcho! What a great hotel this was for our first few days in Tokyo -- it gave us a perfect introduction to the city. We were very fortunate to stay in one of the lovely Japanese rooms and, though we are a young couple, we thought that because of the layout and decoration of the room this would be an especially fun hotel for a couple with one or two small children. We imagined the option to change the space with the sliding doors and the novelty of the tatami mats would be pretty amusing. I drank the delicious green tea provided by the hotel every morning and every afternoon. The separate living area made it an especially good place to unwind and adjust our very confused internal clocks after a long flight, and the minibar sure came in handy! Staff was helpful, calling us a cab back to the station and answering any questions we had. Cab drivers DID have difficulty finding it, but I printed out a map that helped somewhat. Neither driver seemed to have this newfangled GPS technology that works with a phone number. Also I communicated with the hotel several times via email, including once to change my reservation because I didn't realize our flight was an overnight one, and they were always prompt and helpful in their response.Overall a fantastic stay. I'm in Tokyo right now at a different hotel (Hotel Kitcho was booked!) and though it's pretty nice we'll always remember the Kitcho as one of our favorite parts of the trip!
Reviews.Author: ubergenius

Reviews.Content: Excellent value, but rough around the edges I agree with previous reviews that Hotel Kitcho is an excellent value; I did a lot of research before we booked and I think budget travelers will be hard-pressed to find a better deal. We paid about $120 per night US for a very spacious Japanese room and we enjoyed the experience very much -- glad we didn't stay in some big chain hotel. Metro access was very convenient and we were able to get anywhere we wanted with no more than one station transfer. The front desk staff was very friendly and they accommodated us with a late 1 pm checkout on our last day. The room was very clean.My only reservations about giving Hotel Kitcho an excellent review is that the 3rd floor lobby -- where Japanese rooms are located -- was absolutely disgusting when we were there. The carpet was badly stained and in need of replacement ... in particular there was one huge reddish-brown stain right outside our door that we jokingly referred to as where they dumped the body. There was no AC in the lobby and it created a very unpleasant and muggy odor when we were there in July -- coupled with the stains I really hated walking to our room. Also, the room itself is definitely starting to look a little worn and shabby -- bubbling wallpaper and big dents in the particle board doors, tears on our Japanese-style futons, etc. (Unlike the lobby, the room was very clean, though.)I honestly don't say this to put people off, and if we had to do it over I would still book the Hotel Kitcho, It's a budget property and you can't expect the Ritz. Still, I hope the management realizes that the property is in need of some simple maintenance to maintain its reputation as a good value hotel.
Reviews.Author: Oliviadawg

Reviews.Content: A hidden gem tucked away in an alleyway in Nihonbashi       First floor looking from the front lobby - the left side is the elevator and the restaurant on r
Reviews.Author: mikka709

Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in lovely neighbourhood We stayed at Kitcho for 5 nights in March and had a wonderful experience. We booked a Japanese style room for the first 2 nights. This was a huge room with a little hallway, living room, bedroom with tea table and tea making facilities and a spacious shower and bathroom. We also opted for the western breakfast in the hotel which was good value. For the last three nights we stayed in the western style double room. This was a good value room, but the bathroom was tiny (but adaquate!). The Japanese style room is a really special experience and is great value. The staff in Kitcho were always very helpful and friendly during our stay. The neighbourhood is quiet and pretty with lots of nice little local shops and restaurants. It is also just a 5min walk to the nearest subway station. I would definately stay here if iI was n Tokyo again!
Reviews.Author: CiaraMuzz

Reviews.Content: OMG this place was awesome!       The very large room
Reviews.Author: gazzmills20

Reviews.Content: Great little find.. spacious! and typical Japenese style       Bedding area..this is where you lay out the bedding
Reviews.Author: clarems

Reviews.Content: Conveniently located, very homely The hotel location was amazing! It was close to the Hibiya and the Asakua line. The Ningya-Cho station was minutes away from there. There are at least 30 restaurants within 5 minutes walking including McDonalds (best breakfast if you like western breakfast, although I am not a fan of McDonalds if you have kids used to American style food it is a life saver). There are many traditional Japanese style restaurants, Indian, Italian, cake shops etc. Shopping is not fantastic but it is not bad either. Nihonbashi was 980 Yen from Tokyo train station by taxi., Staff is pleasant. Rooms are very much like motel rooms so don't expect Hilton style rooms but for $135 in Tokyo this was amazing!
Reviews.Author: dn90003

Reviews.Content: Very comfortable stay in a quiet convenient location       Hotel exterior and greenway
Reviews.Author: Titanole

Reviews.Content: Good value for money Comfortable hotel on a quiet (rare in Tokyo!!!), tree lined street.Conveniently located, close to subway stations and the City Airport Terminal.For Tokyo standards fairly cheap: good value for money.Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: Dutchman-nl

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Japanese rooms! The double rooms are great, but do pay the extra 3000 for a Japanese room, they are more like apartments, with livingroom, bedroom and a wonderful bathroom. The staff is very nice, and although English can be problematic, will do anything they can to help you out. Will definitely stay here again if I come to Tokyo!
Reviews.Author: maggy1001

Reviews.Content: Fantastic, a new favorite for Tokyo!       The hallway leading to the rooms on our floor
Reviews.Author: pinkfairywand

Reviews.Content: Great Place to Stay for a Small Price My family stayed there for 2 nights on 2  3 Dec 2007 in room 508 and though the room isn't big but just nice for us! Best of all, the price is great! However the location is not in the central area but there are 4 subway lines which we can conveniently travel around!It is easy to locate with the map provided on the hotel's website and the staffs are very nice! What i like most is the fast response when i emailed them for a reservation!Overall, a great place to stay for a small price!
Reviews.Author: sc_myinitial

Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel in an exquisite neighbourhood       CorridorToJapaneseRoom304
Reviews.Author: MouMou

Reviews.Content: Great choice Room Type: Double roomNon smoking room : yes Room number: 405Room price: 9000 yens nightBreakfast: noLocation: great, 10min walking from Tokio City Air TerminalTransport: 3 subway lines nearbyRoom size: 5x4 meters but tiny bathroom 2x1meters( if you are taller than 185cm or a little overweight you will not get in.)Bathroom: plastic shower / bathtub clean but dark with hairdryerBed: comfortable smaller than queen-size with clean sheetsWIFI: free in the roomIf you don't mind the tiny bathroom it's a perfect place with very good rates,We recommend it.In top of it, Hotel Kitcho is surrounded by hundreds of restaurants.
Reviews.Author: axltope

Reviews.Content: Kitcho Hotel... BEST VALUE!!       Coffee-tea and library sets with free water.
Reviews.Author: F毛arandir

Reviews.Content: Great value and location Like other reviews we love this hotel and its location. Our family (me, my wife, 12 yrs old daugter, and 10 yrs old son) stayed there for 6 nights during mid-October. We booked through their website and no credit card is needed. We stayed at the Japanese room, which is highly recommend if you gonna stay at this hotel. The room is large enough for 4 of us to stayed and slept in. They have a seperate bathroom and toilet. Their bathroom also has a bathtub for those who like to soak themselves in the traditional onsen bath and their toilet is also one a of those high-tech japanese toilet.The room is not new and it's very clean and comfortable. They provided us with all the little accessories such as coffee, green tea, boiler, japanese snacks, english tea, soap, shampoo, cottonbuts, shaver, microwave, fridge, hair-dryer, toothbrushes + toothpaste.What we like most is their location. It's only 5 min walk to 3 subway station. We used the hibiya line most, since this line connected us to ginza, tokyo tower, ueno, ameyoko, and also to the JR station that linked us to Disney resort.The location is quiet and full of tradional shops. Try some local restaurants around there and it's excellent. On our arrival we took a taxi (660yen) from TCAT but on our departure we walk with our luggage to TCAT which is only 10 mins away. From TCAT you can take the bus to Narita within an hour.We definitely will stay at Kitcho again if we go back to Tokyo.
Reviews.Author: toolkids

Reviews.Content: Excellent Value I believe we paid around 拢40 per night per room for this hotel, which in a very expensive city, and considering the highly central location, was fabulous value. The room was clean, cosy and had everything you need. There were also the quirky little extras that mmake somewhere memorable, such as a video and reading library, it was small and a litte dated, but showed thought about guests' comfort and satisfaction.Overall, a little find that I would stay in again.
Reviews.Author: ali1ali

Reviews.Content: Kitcho       Japanese room - Kitcho
Reviews.Author: Huuhkaja

Reviews.Content: Great Value  We stayed twice at this hotel - for 8 days at the start of our trip and 2 days at the end and it was wonderful. They have both Japanese rooms and Western rooms but we opted for the Japanese rooms at the start (which we preferred) and had to stay in the Western rooms at the end of our holiday when the other rooms were booked out. We slept on Futons which were fairly comfortable and the rooms at this hotel were the biggest we encountered throughout Japan. They also have a Cafe where Breakfast  Lunch are served at very reasonable prices. The location is excellent as it is only a 4 minute walk to the nearest Metro and you are surrounded by great restaurants, shops  bars. Also the bus from Narita Airport stops at a place called T Cat which is only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Ginza - the main shopping area in Tokyo is 2 Metro stops away. We also caught a cab to Tokyo Station for the Shinkansen trains and this was only AU$10. The staff are very helpful although limited English and they were kind enough to look after our large suitcases whilst we caught the trains around Japan. The Japanese rooms cost us about AU$110 a double and the Western about $97. All in all, a great location and great value hotel.
Reviews.Author: Swarovski

Reviews.Content: Great Tokyo value We stayed four nights at Hotel Kitcho in March. The area around the hotel is excellent for cheap eats (noodle shops and bakeries), necessities like pharmacy, conbini store (convenience), subway connections, etc. After the super long air travel (from North Carolina we had to change in Detroit), it was great to get on one comfortable bus from Narita Airport to the Tokyo City Air Terminal...about 50 minutes. ...an easy walk or short taxi ride to Hotel Kitcho. We got the triple room for us and our teenage son. Very small bathroom which was typical for Japan, but the toiletries were especially handy..(shower cap, toothbrush and paste, etc) and the room was well laid out. Altho we were worried about the lack of non-smoking rooms,, there was no odor (I am picky about this), AND it had windows that open, something one misses in USA budget hotels. The hotel fronts onto a mini park so it's not noisy, which is especially nice in such a huge city. Friendly staff...not much English. We would return to Hotel Kitcho.
Reviews.Author: sheilavelkro

Reviews.Content: Japanese Rooms Highly Recommended I stayed at this hotel with my eight year old daughter for five nights in December 2006. The first night we spent in a standard twin room which was functional and well equipped, but a bit tired. Biggest problem was smoking smells coming through the ventilation, and so I would not recommend the standard rooms based on this experience. Fortunately on the second night we moved to a traditional Japanese style room, which was awesome. The Japanese style rooms are more like an apartment, with a large bathroom, separate toilet, living room with Japanese table, tea service and lots of little extras such as Japanese sweets and trinkets that made it feel like we were in a Japanese home. There was also a separate dining area with fridge, microwave, table and two chairs, plus a bedroom. Folding screens separated all the rooms. Hotel Kitcho is well located -- heaps of places to eat and shop nearby, and close proximity to three subway stations. We took the Airport Limousine to TCAT and then a 700 yen taxi ride to the hotel, although those without a child and luggage in tow could probably walk from TCAT in a few minutes. I would highly recommend Hotel Kitcho.
Reviews.Author: kiwitravellers-7

Reviews.Content: Great location We stayed here in June with our 3 year old daughter for 4 nights. The location was great with plenty of train stations close by. The hotel is traditional and the staff are very friendly. There is plenty to do in the area with some lovely restuarants and shops. We would definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: H D & E

Reviews.Content: reasonable hotel I have just returned from a long stay in Japan and stayed in hotel Kitcho twice during my time there. This was the first hotel I stayed in in Tokyo and I have to say I was initially impressed with the space of the room for the price. It is cheap at 9000 yen per night. The room was pleasant enough but the carpets and walls were dirty. The bathroom was also very small with a leaking bath and holes around the sink stuck together with tape. This didn't really bother me because I was not planning to spend much time in the hotel room. The location is fantastic and very close to subway stations for easy access to everything.I booked the hotel again before I was leaving Tokyo simply because of the location and value. This time we found the hotel room to have a really bad smell - almost like sour milk. During the night our air conditioning leaked and wet clothes and documents lying on the floor.I have to admit, although it is fantastic value for Tokyo I would probably not stay here again.
Reviews.Author: roho

Reviews.Content: Lovely neighbourhood, good hotel Stayed at the Hotel Kitcho twice during our trip to Japan. Once when we arrived, for three nights in a Western Room, and then again before we left for 5 nights in the Japanese Room. (In between we went to Kyoto and did some other stuff).Overall we found the hotel to be excellent for the price. The Western room was small but not tiny (I've had smaller rooms in Sydney and paid more), and was clean with all amenities (fridge, microwave, tv, etc). It did smell a little of cigarettes, but that's Japan for you. The staff were really nice, although not much English spoken (not a problem though).The Japanese room that we had during our 2nd stay was HUGE. It was almost like a suite, with separate bathroom  toilet, 2 sitting areas, and the sleeping area. The best bit about the hotel, though is the area I think. Other parts of Tokyo can be a bit frenetic, and I loved coming back to the hotel and its neighbourhood at the end of the day - very quiet and traditional  quite charming. It is very convenient, too, easy walking distance to three different subway lines so you can get practically anywhere, only 4 stops to Ueno and 2 to Akihabara.Highly recommended for anyone on a budget!
Reviews.Author: dannir

Reviews.Content: Excellent location, Free internet access, plus its cheap!       Our Messy room!
Reviews.Author: Nuttycam

Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and spacious Japanese room       Selection of Pillows
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: nice budget hotel Booked our June stay at Hotel Kitcho based on tripadvisor comments (we are at the hotel as I write this review). A definite budget hotel (9000yen for a small double) in a very low key neighborhood of Tokyo.Plus: Wonderful staff. In-room inernet (ask for package). Nice neighborhood with TONS of little shops/restaurants (see web link for some of the many, many choices: [------] or google tokyo gourment navigator and select ningycho neighborhood). Close to subway stations. In room: coffee, tea, hot-water, free bottled water, refrigerator, microwave, tv, razor, toothbrush, brush, shampoo/rinse, bath salts, yukata. There is also a small coin-op washer/dryer and a stash of pillows in case yours isn't right for you.Downside: The hotel is a bit dated and the bathroom is TINY (no japanese high-tech toilets here). Note: If you are coming in via Tokyo Station (as we have been doing from the airport and shinkansen) be prepared for about a 25-30 minute commute (walking and subway) to get to the hotel. This hotel definitely isn't right for everyone -- but if you are budget minded, like a quiet spot to relax at the end of the day then check out Hotel Kitcho.
Reviews.Author: greenkat

Reviews.Content: Hotel Kitcho one of Tokyo's hidden secrets I looked up budget hotels in a good location for Tokyo on Trip advisor, and found Hotel Kitcho. Once again, trip advisor found me a great hotel that was very affordable. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the hotel is in a great location next to the Metro. The staff and very friendly and accommodating, and I would certainly recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great value hotel in excellent location We stayed at the Hotel Kitcho for a total of 5 nights recently and though it was excellent value for money in Tokyo. It is in a relatively quiet residential area, but very close to metro stations and surrounded by restaurants and cafes. The rooms are a little bigger than average (for Japan), although you do get the same 'identikit' plastic bathroom cubicles that you find throughout Japan, that I have previously only seen in caravans! The rooms we stayed in were clean and comfortable, the bathrooms are a little dated, but i still think that the hotel is excellent value for such a major city. The staff are very helpful and a great deal of care is taken with the hotel and it's facilities.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fine hotel; great price and location I stayed in a western room for 3 nights at the start of my Japan trip and again on my last night in Tokyo. The first room was a fantastic single with shoji screens across the windows, a hugh wrap around desk, etc. It was not large by American standards, but was better than many rooms I have had in Europe and very inexpensive considering it is in central Tokyo. The room I had on my last night was not as japanese as the first room; no Shoji screens, etc. Sort of small Holiday Inn feel to it. However, there was a choice of buckwheat hull pillows to be had, depending on the firmness level you wanted, charcoal buckets in each room as natural deodorizor, etc. They provided traditional Japanese robes (Yakata) in each room, which was a neat thing. Also, provided packets of drip coffee and tea, along with a small refrigerator and mini bar in each room.The front desk staff was very helpful with everything and generally had one person who spoke English. The on-site ground floor restaurant/cafe had terrific breakfasts for 10,000 yen (about $9.00) which included a piece of grilled salmon, large bowl of rice porridge, poached egg, little dried fish (warning, looked like shredded coconut - but with eyes), and assorted other little plates of food, plus jiuce and coffee..... The Keiske dinner at the 2nd floor restaurant was OK if you have no other chance for Kyoto-style dinner, but it was a disappointment. Tokyo Cental Air Terminal is in walking distance - even with rolling luggage - and several Metro stops are also within blocks to all of Tokyo is easily available. The immediate neighborhood is terrific with lots of small shops and restaurants; all very low scale and not at all what one would think when you think Tokyo...... I loved the Hotel and its entire experience; especially the price.
Reviews.Author: Keith58

Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a lovely area       Cozy beds and nice pillows
Reviews.Author: kang_a_ji

Reviews.Content: Experience memorable japanese culture at affordable cost We chanced upon the website of Hotel Kitcho while looking for an affordable and convenient place to stay for our holiday in Tokyo Japan. Upon reading further good reviews on this hotel, we decided to book our accomodation via email. We stayed for 4 nights. 2 nights in Western Twin room (9000 yen) and 2 in Japanese style room (12000 yen). The experience was fantastic especially the last 2 nights in the Japanese room. It was a really big suite for the 2 of us! We were initially worried about getting used to the tatami mats and futon beds but the comfortable mattresses and thoughtful amenities (e.g. attached bathroom with a bathtub for soaking/onsen style, air purifier, microwave oven, sewing kits etc) in the hotel/room removed all our unnecessary worries. It is hard to imagine living in the central district of Tokyo with such an affordable cost and such cosy atmosphere. Our choice was correct. The streets around the hotel in ningyo-cho also traces back to Edo-period and some have retained their flavour and trades [like senbei (fried crackers), amezake (sweet rice wine), soya milk...etc]. The hotel is centrally located near a convenient subway station of abt 5 minutes walk and is easily accessible to other parts of Tokyo thru the Hibiya subway line. Overall, fantastic place to stay! Definitely my choice if I return to Tokyo again!
Reviews.Author: strawberrychan

Reviews.Content: Not as expected but... We stayed at Hotel Kitcho from April 7-9 of this year.The location is good because it is near TCAT (where you get a limousine bus to and from narita) but it is difficult to find it. We stayed at twin B room, although it is bigger than the usual size of business hotel room in tokyo this hotel really needs renovation. The carpet and walls are dirty and lavatory has holes around it.It may not be as we expected, but for 9000 yen a room this may be considered a good deal for an accomodation in tokyo.If room size is not a big deal. I suggest that you get a room at Comfort Hotel Kiyosumi where we stayed for 5 days from march 29- april 3. This hotel is new, very clean, with high speed internet connections in all rooms and with free buffet continental breakfast everyday. It is just the next train stop after Kitcho.
Reviews.Author: distinct_taste

Reviews.Content: Hotel Kitcho a Great Local Hotel This was my first trip to Japan with my wife who is native Japanese and in the USA the past six years. I wanted to experience Tokyo and Japan as opposed to staying in one of the large business hotels. I found the Hotel Kitcho via Google and checked it out on Trip Advisor. My wife was a little concerned because neither she nor any of her friends who live in Tokyo had ever heard of it. We stayed four nites in one of the Japanese style rooms..was excellent..my wife who is on the picky side absolutely loved it...not glamorous and not a lot in terms of services but very clean, spacious and provides a real Japanese experience. Good location near several subway stops and roughly 20 minutes to Ginza, Roppongi, Shubuya, the Imperial Palace and other popular spots. Neighborhood has coffee shops and local places to eat. The Japanese style rooms offer tatami floors, futons and ample area for working, television etc...If you want health clubs, instant room service, big lobbies and the like, go elsewhere. However, if you want to stay in a Japanese neighborhood and enjoy genuine Japanese lodging, we strongly recommend one of the Japanese rooms at the Hotel Kitcho.For those of you still contemplating your first trip to Tokyo I'd highly recommend it as a destination. My first trip at age 46 and although I had the benefit of my wife as interpreter and her personal knowledge of Japan and Tokyo, without her it would have still been a great experience.
Reviews.Author: brysully

Reviews.Content: Loved it!   showReview(4595030, 'full');
Reviews.Author: IDE

Reviews.Content: Excellent value and location   showReview(4579788, 'full');
Reviews.Author: wurly_monster

Reviews.Content: Fantastic value   showReview(4442299, 'full');

Reviews.Content: japanese rooms great   showReview(4396076, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location   showReview(4153658, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Value, Great Location   showReview(4071881, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Hotel Kitcho - excellent value for Tokyo   showReview(4016344, 'full');

Reviews.Content: hotel kitcho, we will be back !   showReview(3337779, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Cosy Japanese hospitality in the heart of Tokyo       Hotel Kitcho
Reviews.Author: aukahkay

Reviews.Content: Est谩 bien ubicado y es muy funcional (recomiendo la habitaci贸n Estilo Japon茅s)   showReview(16814612, 'full');

Reviews.Content: superguenstig   showReview(5027268, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Mae585_123
